intro: Perityle plumigera, commonly known as the feathered perityle, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Perityle plumigera thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its delicate structure and unique appearance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
